did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office. Burkhard Schwarz papers

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. Burkhard Schwarz was an advertising executive who served as Managing Director of JWT's Frankfurt Office from 1977-1989. Collection includes correspondence, financial summaries, client files, speeches, meeting minutes and other materials, planning and research reports, and new business presentations. Companies represented include Bacardi, Burger King, DeBeers, Ford, Hill & Knowlton, Jacobs, Kodak, Nestle, Philips, Sunlicht and Unilever. Materials are in German and English. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office. Burkhard Schwarz papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office. Burkhard Schwarz papers was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a transfer in 1996.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection originally formed part of the J. Walter Thompson Company Frankfurt Office records transferred in 1996 (1996-009).

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: 1936: Born, Berlin. 1955-1958: Apprentice, Edeka Grosseinkauf. 1958-1959: Trainee, Schroder & Schyler. 1959-1960: Marketing Manager, Ph. de Rothschild.

JWT career: 1960-1962 Traffic Dept.; 1963 Account Representative, Frankfurt; 1964-1966 Amsterdam; 1967-1970 Account Representative, Account Supervisor, Vienna; 1971 Account Director, Managing Supervisor, Frankfurt; 1977 Senior Vice President, Managing Director, Frankfurt; 1989 retired from JWT.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, financial summaries, client files, speeches, meeting minutes and other materials, planning and research reports, and new business presentations. Companies represented include Bacardi, Burger King, DeBeers, Ford, Hill & Knowlton, Jacobs, Kodak, Nestle, Philips, Sunlicht and Unilever. Materials are in German and English. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising &, and Marketing History.
